issue.title: Enable efficient retrieval of file size from directory_entry

discussion.p:
On Windows, the FindFileData WIN32_FIND_DATA structure, which is the underlying data type for directory_entry, contains the file size as one of the fields.
Thus efficient enumeration of files and getting their sizes is possible without doing a separate query for the file size.

p.i: In Class directory_entry add the following observer declarations:

blockquote.pre: uintmax_t file_size(); uintmax_t file_size(error_code& ec) noexcept;

p.i: In directory_entry observers add the following:

blockquote.pre: uintmax_t file_size(); uintmax_t file_size(error_code& ec) noexcept;

blockquote.p: Returns: if *this contains a cached file size, return it. Otherwise return file_size(path()) or file_size(path(), ec) respectively.
